notes:
1. Hydraulic Power

The power delivered to a fluid by a pump, or extracted from a fluid by a turbine.

$$ P_{fluid} = \gamma Q H = \rho g Q H $$
  • $Q$: Flow rate (m続/s).
  • $H$: Head added or removed (m).
  • $\gamma$: Specific weight (N/m続).

2. Brake Power (Shaft Power)

The actual mechanical power at the shaft ($P_{shaft}$ or BHP).

3. Efficiency ($\eta$)

  • Pump Efficiency: $\eta_P = \frac{\text{Power to Fluid}}{\text{Shaft Power In}} = \frac{\gamma Q H}{P_{shaft}}$
  • Turbine Efficiency: $\eta_T = \frac{\text{Shaft Power Out}}{\text{Power from Fluid}} = \frac{P_{shaft}}{\gamma Q H}$

solvedExamples.question: A pump delivers 0.05 m続/s of water against a head of 20 m. If the pump is 80% efficient, what is the required shaft power? ($\gamma = 9810$ N/m続)
solvedExamples.explanation: Fluid power $P_f = \gamma Q H = (9810)(0.05)(20) = 9810$ W = 9.81 kW. Shaft power $P_{shaft} = P_f / \eta = 9.81 / 0.80 = 12.26$ kW.
